intro: Connarus triangularis, commonly known as the triangular connarus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive triangular-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
